intro: Linanthus eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
